intro: Biscutella laevigata var. mollis, commonly known as the smooth biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are smooth and oval-shaped, and it produces yellow flowers in early spring. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, rounded stems and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
